summary: This is an email exchange from March 2002 between 'G. Max' and 'The Invisible Man' discussing arranging a trip to Peru for 'Andrew' to see the Nazca Lines. The email emphasizes discretion, fun with 'intelligent pretty fun' companions from 'good families', and avoiding publicity.

persons.name: G. Max
persons.context: Sends email to 'The Invisible Man' arranging a trip for Andrew to Peru, emphasizing discretion and fun with suitable companions.

persons.name: The Invisible Man
persons.context: Receives email from G. Max and is tasked with showing Andrew a wonderful time in Peru, introducing him to trusted, discreet friends.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.context: An English-sounding gentleman interested in seeing the Nazca Lines in Peru; G. Max has provided his telephone number and requests a discreet, fun trip with suitable companions.

connections.description: G. Max is arranging a trip for Andrew with The Invisible Man, expressing trust and reliance on him to provide a discreet, fun experience.
G. Max has given Andrew's telephone number to The Invisible Man and is facilitating Andrew's trip to Peru, indicating a personal connection.
The Invisible Man is expected to be Andrew's tour guide in Peru, showing him around and introducing him to trusted friends.

events.title: Email arranging Peru trip for Andrew
events.description: G. Max emails The Invisible Man to arrange a trip to Peru for Andrew to see the Nazca Lines, emphasizing discretion and fun with suitable companions.

keyFacts: The email discusses arranging a discreet trip to Peru for 'Andrew' to see the Nazca Lines.
The trip is to include '2 legged sight seeing (read intelligent pretty fun and from good families)', implying social introductions.
G. Max emphasizes that Andrew does not want any publicity about the trip or whom he saw.
The correspondence highlights a network arranging private, discreet travel for associates.
